title: Active Equities to Watch in the Technology Sector -- Amkor Technology, Fairchild Semiconductor Intl., Lattice Semiconductor, Qlogic, and Applied Micro Circuits
text: Active Equities to Watch in the Technology Sector -- Amkor Technology, Fairchild Semiconductor Intl., Lattice Semiconductor, Qlogic, and Applied Micro Circuits   Published on 2015-09-16 05:17:48 Active Equities to Watch in the Technology Sector -- Amkor Technology, Fairchild... -- NEW YORK, September    > NEW YORK , September   Equity Research Institute has initiated coverage on the following equities: Amkor Technology Inc. (NASDAQ: AMKR ), Fairchild Semiconductor International Inc. (NASDAQ: FCS ), Lattice Semiconductor Corporation (NASDAQ: LSCC ), QLogic Corporation (NASDAQ: QLGC ), and Applied Micro Circuits Corporation (NASDAQ: AMCC ). Free research report on Amkor Technology can be accessed at https://www.erionline.net/reports?keyword=AMKR On Tuesday, September 15, 2015 , the NASDAQ Composite ended at 4,860.52, up 1.14%, the Dow Jones Industrial Average advanced 1.40%, to finish the day at 16,599.85, and the S&P 500 closed at 1,978.09, up 1.28%. The gains were broad based as all the sectors ended the session in positive. Register for your complimentary reports at the links given below. Amkor Technology Inc.'s stock finished Tuesday's session 0.38% higher at $5.31 . A total of 1.30 million shares were traded, which was below its three months average volume of 1.66 million shares. Over the previous three months and since the beginning of 2015, Amkor Technology Inc.'s shares have plummeted 16.90% and 25.21%, respectively. However, the stock has gained 19.33% in the last one month. The company's shares are trading above their 50-day moving average by 7.42%. Amkor Technology Inc.'s stock traded at a PE ratio of 12.95 and has a Relative Strength Index (RSI) of 55.82. Sign up and read the free notes on AMKR at: https://www.erionline.net/reports?keyword=AMKR On Tuesday, shares in Fairchild Semiconductor International Inc. ended the session 0.29% higher at $13.66 . The stock reported a trading volume of 1.09 million shares, below its three months average volume of 1.41 million shares. Fairchild Semiconductor International Inc.'s shares have declined 5.40% in the last one month, 27.69% in the previous three months and 19.08% on YTD basis. The company is trading 7.02% below its 50-day moving average and 20.17% below its 200-day moving average. Moreover, shares of Fairchild Semiconductor International Inc. have an RSI of 46.64. The complimentary notes on FCS can be downloaded in PDF format at: https://www.erionline.net/reports?keyword=FCS Lattice Semiconductor Corp.'s stock lost 1.47%, to close the day at $4.03 . The stock recorded a trading volume of 1.11 million shares, close to its three months average volume of 1.20 million shares. Over the last one month and over the previous three months, Lattice Semiconductor Corp.'s shares have declined 0.49% and 36.73%, respectively. Furthermore, the stock has plummeted 41.51% since the start of this year. The company's shares are trading 14.20% below their 50-day moving average. Additionally, Lattice Semiconductor Corp. has an RSI of 37.10. Register for free on Equity Research Institute and access the latest research on LSCC at: https://www.erionline.net/reports?keyword=LSCC On Tuesday, shares in QLogic Corp. recorded a trading volume of 0.67 million shares, lower than their three months average volume of 1.27 million shares. The stock ended the day 0.19% higher at $10.37 . Shares of the company traded at a PE ratio of 19.57. Although, QLogic Corp.'s stock has gained 10.79% in the last one month, it has lost 32.00% in the previous three months and 22.15% on YTD basis. The company is trading below its 50-day and 200-day moving averages by 1.24% and 21.78%, respectively. Furthermore, shares of QLogic Corp. have an RSI of 53.88. The complete research on QLGC is available for free at: https://www.erionline.net/reports?keyword=QLGC Applied Micro Circuits Corp.'s stock edged 0.69% higher, to close Tuesday's session at $5.81 . The stock recorded a trading volume of 0.42 million shares, below its three months average volume of 1.05 million shares. Over the last one month and the previous three months, Applied Micro Circuits Corp.'s shares have declined 0.68% and 17.82%, respectively. Additionally, the stock has lost 10.89% since the start of this year. The company is trading 1.99% and 1.39% below its 50-day and 200-day moving averages, respectively. Furthermore, Applied Micro Circuits Corp.'s stock has an RSI of 50.24. ERI has two distinct and independent departments. One department produces non-sponsored analyst certified content generally in the form of press releases, articles and reports covering equities listed on NYSE and NASDAQ and the other produces sponsored content (in most cases not reviewed by a registered analyst), which typically consists of compensated investment newsletters, articles and reports covering listed stocks and micro-caps.
